issue.title: Expose settings via API following a more extensible design

labels.name: User Role: API User
labels.description: Makes use of APIs

labels.name: Size: 33
labels.description: A percentage of a sprint. 23.1 hours.

labels.name: pm.GREI-d-2.7.1
labels.description: NIH, yr2, aim7, task1: R&D UI modules for creating datasets and supporting publishing workflows

labels.name: pm.GREI-d-2.7.2
labels.description: NIH, yr2, aim7, task2: Implement UI modules for creating datasets and publishing workflows

issue.body:
**Overview of the Feature Request**

New settings are now required by the SPA (hasPublicStore, getAllowedExternalStatuses) and others will be necessary during the development of the SPA.

Since reading settings will be usual for the SPA, we may need to redesign the way we expose them through API. It may be interesting to follow the approach described on https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/pull/9881#issuecomment-1714120660 and complemented on https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/pull/9881#issuecomment-1714153633 and https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/pull/9881#issuecomment-1714177290
 
**What kind of user is the feature intended for?**
API User

**What inspired the request?**

- SPA needs
- https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/pull/9881#issuecomment-1714120660
- https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/pull/9881#issuecomment-1714153633
- https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/pull/9881#issuecomment-1714177290

**What existing behavior do you want changed?**

None

**Any brand new behavior do you want to add to Dataverse?**

New mechanism to retrieve settings via API

**Any open or closed issues related to this feature request?**

- - https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/pull/9881

comment.body:
We have decided to work on a document for the analysis of the new design, before moving on to its development.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qaXFmM6qwApd-DYMdbWh2_obfeNzC_Do5_PY2oV9_R8

issue.title: QueryDSL APT processing break JaCoCo code coverage reporting

labels.name: Component: Code Infrastructure
labels.description: formerly "Feature: Code Infrastructure"

issue.body:
As can be seen in the action logs ([here's an example](https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/actions/runs/6469750216/job/17564690918), see under "Deposit Code Coverage"), the Coveralls plugin cannot find sources for classed generated by QueryDSL.

Usually these should be ignored by JaCoCo, but they are present as the default annotation [`javax.annotation.processing.Generated`](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.compiler/javax/annotation/processing/Generated.html) has retention scope `SOURCE` and is no longer visible to JaCoCo.

[CoverAll Maven plugin doc says: do not include generated sources.](https://github.com/trautonen/coveralls-maven-plugin#faq) (Which makes sense - why would we count that...)

issue.body:
**Overview of the Feature Request**

As decided at the frontend weekly meeting on 19th October, DatasetVersionFilesServiceBean should be rewritten using JPA Criteria instead of QueryDSL. After all code is rewritten, the Dataverse library will be removed.

**What kind of user is the feature intended for?**
N/A

**What inspired the request?**

- Architecture decisions
- Frontend weekly meeting

**What existing behavior do you want changed?**

None

**Any brand new behavior do you want to add to Dataverse?**

None

**Any open or closed issues related to this feature request?**
 
PR where QueryDSL is introduced:

- https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/pull/9783

pull_request.title: Rewrite DatasetVersionFilesServiceBean QueryDSL queries using JPA Criteria and remove the QueryDSL library from the application dependencies
pull_request.body:
**What this PR does / why we need it**:

As decided at the frontend weekly meeting on 19th October, DatasetVersionFilesServiceBean has been rewritten using JPA Criteria instead of QueryDSL. The QueryDSL library has been removed.

**Which issue(s) this PR closes**:

- Closes #10028
- Closes https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/issues/9990

**Suggestions on how to test this**:

The following API endpoints use the rewritten queries:

- getVersionFiles _/datasets/{id}/versions/{versionId}/files_ (https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/blob/develop/doc/sphinx-guides/source/api/native-api.rst#list-files-in-a-dataset)
 
- getVersionFileCounts _/datasets/{id}/versions/{versionId}/files/counts_ (https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/blob/develop/doc/sphinx-guides/source/api/native-api.rst#get-file-counts-in-a-dataset)

- getDownloadSize _/datasets/{id}/versions/{versionId}/downloadsize_ (https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/blob/develop/doc/sphinx-guides/source/api/native-api.rst#get-the-size-of-downloading-all-the-files-of-a-dataset-version)

Despite we can test manual curl calls to these endpoints by sending different combinations of parameters (Described in the Native API documentation) and verify that they work correctly, testing all cases is extensive. Integration tests mainly cover all possible scenarios, so to verify the new implementation we can check that all test cases still pass as they did with the previous QueryDSL implementation.

**Does this PR introduce a user interface change? If mockups are available, please link/include them here**:

No

**Is there a release notes update needed for this change?**:

No

labels.description: A percentage of a sprint. 2.1 hours.

comment.body: Note that in #9669, I switched from using channels to streams because the channel.transferFrom method is not guaranteed to transfer all bytes (and can transfer 0 bytes) whereas the InputStream.transferTo method blocks until all bytes are transferred. I don't know if that's relevant here too (i.e. if this code also has that potential bug).

issue.title: Use try-with-resources in DatasetUtil.java to close "src = new FileInputStream(tmpFile).getChannel();" and also "dest = new FileOutputStream(tmpFile).getChannel();"  in method persistDatasetLogoToStorageAndCreateThumbnails(...)
Use try-with-resources to close "FileInputStream gzippedIn = new FileInputStream(f);" in FileUtil.java in method determineFileType(...)
Different contribution of mime type .wav
issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to the Dataverse Project through the creation of a bug report!

WARNING: If this is a security issue it should be reported privately to security@dataverse.org

More information on bug issues and contributions can be found in the "Contributing to Dataverse" page:
https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reportsissues

Please fill out as much of the template as you can.
Start below this comment section.
-->
**What steps does it take to reproduce the issue?**
When I upload an audio file, Dataverse shows in the Type=audio/vnd.wave


* When does this issue occur? 
we have observed with the modification of the typemime on our servers, with the evolution of our JDK 


* Which page(s) does it occurs on?
![vnd_wave](https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/assets/145585953/89119ec4-5163-467f-94a9-55099a7f0e8a)
 on the upload page for a [dataset]([url](![vnd_wave](https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/assets/145585953/6e180588-cac1-4d07-92a6-1e2cf41bbfce)))


* What happens?


* To whom does it occur (all users, curators, superusers)?


* What did you expect to happen?
it must shows Type= Waveform Audio 

We propose two solutions to do:
Should we add the audio/vnd.wave type so that we will handle all the type of wav/vnd.wave/, or it's up to the dataverse side to force the audio/vnd.wave type.
Which solution you recommend?

**Which version of Dataverse are you using?** 5.14



**Any related open or closed issues to this bug report?**



**Screenshots:**

No matter the issue, screenshots are always welcome.

To add a screenshot, please use one of the following formats and/or methods described here:

* https://help.github.com/en/articles/file-attachments-on-issues-and-pull-requests
*

comment.body:
Huh. I see what you mean. It's detected as "Waveform Audio" upon initial upload/save...

![Screenshot 2023-10-26 at 2 55 32 PM](https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/assets/21006/6c37045d-3447-4667-95a9-290249043c7c)

... but the re-detect API wants to change the content type:

```
$ curl -s -H "X-Dataverse-key:$API_TOKEN" -X POST "$SERVER_URL/api/files/$ID/redetect?dryRun=true" | jq .
{
  "status": "OK",
  "data": {
    "dryRun": true,
    "oldContentType": "audio/x-wav",
    "newContentType": "audio/vnd.wave"
  }
}
```

I'm not sure what's going on, honestly. 🤔 

But yeah, like you said, a quick fix for how the file looks would be to add "audio/vnd.wave" to the property files.

I don't really like how the content type changes, though. Very strange. And mysterious.

issue.title: Data access request seems to go to file contributor instead of dataset contact

labels.name: Type: Suggestion
labels.description: an idea

labels.name: User Role: Depositor
labels.description: Creates datasets, uploads data, etc.

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to the Dataverse Project through the creation of a bug report!

WARNING: If this is a security issue it should be reported privately to security@dataverse.org

More information on bug issues and contributions can be found in the "Contributing to Dataverse" page:
https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reportsissues

Please fill out as much of the template as you can.
Start below this comment section.
-->
**What steps does it take to reproduce the issue?**

Requesting access to restricted files where the file uploader does not correspond with dataset contact.

* When does this issue occur?

Requesting access to restricted files where the file uploader does not correspond with dataset contact.

* Which page(s) does it occurs on?

Dataset-page, under Files.

* What happens?

When requesting acces to restricted files, the access request seems to automatically end up with the file uploader instead of the appointed dataset contact.

* To whom does it occur (all users, curators, superusers)?

All users.

* What did you expect to happen?

We expect that all access requests go to the dataset manager(s) (i.e. dataset contact), and not individual file uploaders.

**Which version of Dataverse are you using?**

5.12

**Any related open or closed issues to this bug report?**

No.

**Screenshots:**

No matter the issue, screenshots are always welcome.

To add a screenshot, please use one of the following formats and/or methods described here:

* https://help.github.com/en/articles/file-attachments-on-issues-and-pull-requests
*

comment.body:
Yes! Exactly! That's a good way to think about it. Dataset contacts are metadata not users.

In the code we refer to users as "authenticated users" which is why you see `au` in the code I mentioned. Here it is again:

```
userNotificationService.sendNotification(au...
```

If you want to make a pull request, it would probably easier to create a variation on that method that accepts an email address (a string) rather than trying to turn dataset contacts into authenticated users.

If you go down this route, I'd also suggest making this feature configurable: off by default but a feature installations can turn on.

I hope this makes sense! Please keep the questions coming!

issue.title: Document Subpath-based Installation (e.g. https://domain.org/dataverse)

labels.name: Type: Suggestion
labels.description: an idea

labels.name: User Role: Sysadmin
labels.description: Installs, upgrades, and configures the system, connects via ssh

labels.name: Component: JSF
labels.description: Involves modifying JSF (Jakarta Server Faces) code, which is being replace with React.

labels.name: UX & UI: New React UI
labels.description: Needs enough design work that it should probably go in the new React UI, not JSF

issue.body: Dataverse installation currently only supports URLs without a path (e.g. https://domain.org). Hence, it is mandatory to use a subdomain (e.g. https://dataverse.domain.org) or to use 3rd party tools to translate URL addressed on-the-fly (beyond URL rewriting). Would you consider supporting custom paths natively? Adding a baseURL parameter, or extending siteURL parameter to support path besides domain name and port might be a solution.

comment.body:
https://science-data.hu is another example. @pallinger just let us know about it here:

- https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse-installations/issues/216
